title: Digne's illegal throw-in led to Everton goal

replies.msg:
Fans on Twitter are livid as Everton's first goal seemed to be scored against the rules. While taking the throw-in, Digne had his foot over the touchline which should have meant the throw-in to be retaken.


"At the moment of delivering the ball, the thrower must:

stand facing the field of play

have part of each foot on the touchline or on the ground outside the touchline

throw the ball with both hands from behind and over the head from the point where it left the field of play."

As we see, the second requirement was not fulfilled by the left-back and it should have been retaken.

However, the referee was looking the other way and Arsenal ended up conceding yet another goal due to mistakes by the refs.

Do you think the goal should have been disallowed? If so, do you think VAR will decrease the number of referee errors next season?
